thread.title: Kansas City Royals Advance To World Series
thread.title_full: Kansas City Royals Advance To World Series

author: David Rind
title: Kansas City Royals Advance To World Series
text:
Share Article 
Ed Zurga/Getty Images (KANSAS CITY, Mo.) – The Kansas City Royals are back in the World Series.Eric Hosmer hit an RBI single in the eighth inning to break a 3-3 tie after a 45-minute rain delay to lead the Royals to a 4-3 win over the Toronto Blue Jays in Game 6 of the American League Championship Series.The Royals return to the World Series after losing to the San Francisco Giants last season in 7 games. They will face the New York Mets on Tuesday night.Blue Jays outfielder Jose Bautista tied the game in the top of the eighth inning with a two-run home run, his second blast of the game. In the bottom of the inning, Lorenzo Cain lead of the inning with a walk for the Royals, and scored on Hosmer’s single down the right field line."Our guys, from the first day of spring training, their focus was to get back to the World Series," Royals manager Ned Yost said, "and they did it."The Blue Jays had won four straight possible elimination games, but came up short."They made a run at it," Toronto manager John Gibbons said. "I really couldn't be more proud of our guys. They laid it out every day. They're great competitors and a fun bunch."Kansas City’s appearance in last year’s World Series was their first in 29 years.Copyright © 2015, ABC Radio. All rights reserved. Saturday, October 24, 2015 at 4:56AM
